results.firPara: Todays fluff is chewing it up and spitting it out
results.secPara: Todays fluff is chewing it up and spitting it out
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Moussa Sissoko to Tottenham?

results.firPara: Chelsea will make a €35m (£30m) bid for the Milan centre-back Alessio Romagnoli on Wednesday as Antonio Conte tries to add depth to his squad before the transfer window closes next week, with another €5m in performance-related add-ons.
results.secPara: The Serie A club are desperate to hold on to the 21-year-old Italy under-21 international but could be tempted to sell this summer if the current owner, Silvio Berlusconi, as well as the future owners, Haixa Capital, who will take over the club in November, believe they can get an adequate replacement for Romagnoli before the window closes. They are interested in signing São Paulos Rodrigo Caio.
results.webTitle: Chelsea to submit £30m bid for Milan defender Alessio Romagnoli

results.firPara: Celtic qualified for the Champions League by only losing 2-0 at Hapoel Beer Sheva, while Derby beat Carlisle 14-13 on penalties in the EFL Cu
results.secPara: Celtic qualified for the Champions League by only losing 2-0 at Hapoel Beer Sheva, while Derby beat Carlisle 14-13 on penalties in the EFL Cu
results.webTitle: Celtic in Champions League qualifier plus EFL Cup action: clockwatch – as it happened

results.firPara: David Moyes has no intention of selling Lamine Koné if he can possibly help it and believes it would be impossible to sign as good a central defensive replacement for the £21m Everton are prepared to pay.
results.secPara: Koné will stay, said Sunderlands manager before suggesting that, although he had vetoed Evertons bid, it had not been turned down outright by his board.
results.webTitle: David Moyes keen to keep Lamine Koné but rues Sunderland budget restraints

results.firPara: The EFL Cup might be Crystal Palaces best chance of tangible success this season and on a muggy night in south London they barely broke sweat in taking their first steps towards it. Palace recorded a comfortable 2-0 victory against League Two Blackpool, a performance without many flourishes but will be filed under job done, after a sticky start to the Premier League season.
results.secPara: We were a great cup team last year – in both competitions – and we want to be again, the Palace manager, Alan Pardew, said after the game. That was highlighted by the strength of the team I put out.
results.webTitle: Connor Wickham seals EFL Cup win for Crystal Palace against Blackpool

results.firPara: It will take more than a victory against Burton Albion to provide evidence that Liverpool are back on the right path after their sobering defeat at Burnley on Saturday but Jürgen Klopps side did all that was asked of them on a night when the chasm in class was every bit as wide as the scoreline suggests.
results.secPara: Klopps team selection underlined how seriously he was treating this match and, in truth, their progress to the third round of the League Cup was a formality before the midway point of the first half. Courtesy of goals from Divock Origi and Roberto Firmino, Liverpool were 2-0 ahead after 22 minutes and it already felt like an exercise in damage limitation for the Championship club.
results.webTitle: Liverpool rout Burton with Daniel Sturridge double icing on the cake

results.firPara: Antonio Conte was made to feel a little sticky under his starched collar on this sweltering summer night as his makeshift Chelsea side were given a real game by the League One new boys Bristol Rovers.
results.secPara: A Michy Batshuayi double and a simple finish from Victor Moses looked to have been enough for Chelsea to win the game in the first half. But a towering header from Peter Hartley brought the deficit back to two at half‑time and, when Rovers converted a penalty early in the second half, the pressure was thrown back on Chelsea. While his side held on to the win, Conte will now be asking questions about which of his irregulars will be up to the task of meeting the clubs ambitions this season.
results.webTitle: Michy Batshuayi leads Chelsea past Bristol Rovers and into third round

results.firPara: When memories of Ronald Koemans first win at Goodison Park have faded in others minds they will linger long with one Evertonian. Ross Barkley captained his home-town club for the first time and marked a poignant occasion with a goal and the games outstanding performance as last seasons semi-finalists ensured smooth progress. They have not exited at this stage since 2001 and while Yeovil have a proud giantkilling pedigree, they have not eliminated top-flight opposition from any competition since 1949. A gulf of 79 league places proved too wide to bridge for Yeovil, a club who could name only five substitutes.
results.secPara: It illustrated the differing worlds they occupy that Everton could give maiden starts to two newcomers acquired for a combined fee of £39m before bringing Arouna Koné off the bench. The Ivorian struck twice in nine minutes to give the scoreline an unflattering sheen for Yeovil. I was proud of the players, said their manager, Darren Way. You cant be too critical.
results.webTitle: Arouna Koné scores two late goals as Everton cruise past Yeovil

results.firPara: Liverpool score twice in the first half and three times after the break in a straightforward win over Championship opponents Burton, with Daniel Sturridge contributing two goals
results.secPara: Thanks for your company, anyway! And for your emails and other chatter. Well talk again soon – for now, enjoy the rest of your evening/afternoon/morning. Bye!
results.webTitle: Burton Albion 0-5 Liverpool: EFL Cup second round – as it happened

results.firPara: Joe Hart risks placing his career in limbo by staying at Manchester City as a back-up goalkeeper, despite knowing that doing so will threaten his status as Englands No1. Barcelonas Claudio Bravo was pictured arriving at Manchester Airport on Tuesday afternoon with a view to finalising a deal to become Harts replacement for a fee of around £17m.
results.secPara: The 33-year-old Chilean will not sign in time to be selected for Citys Champions League play-off game against Steaua Bucharest on Wednesday night but could go straight into the team for the match against West Ham United at the Etihad Stadium on Sunday. Barça are close to signing Jasper Cillessen from Ajax to replace Bravo.
results.webTitle: Joe Hart risks being in limbo if he stays at Manchester City as back-up keeper
